intro: Hyalostemma roxburghianum, commonly known as the Kashmir nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and other nightshades. The plant is characterized by its attractive blue or violet flowers and hairy stems. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
